publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5536.1 Elaine Smith: Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home—As an amendment to motion (S3M-5536) in the name of John Wilson, leave out from "praises" to end and insert "understands, however, that this is overwhelmingly a crime of male violence against women and children with 88% of crimes and offences of domestic abuse and 95% of crimes of indecency, which are mostly crimes of sexual assault, being perpetrated by men against women, making it clearly a gender issue and an exploitation of power." Supported by: Cathy Peattie*, Marlyn Glen* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-5536.1 Elaine Smith: Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home—As an amendment to motion (S3M-5536) in the name of John Wilson, leave out from "praises" to end and insert "understands, however, that this is overwhelmingly a crime of male violence against women and children with 88% of crimes and offences of domestic abuse and 95% of crimes of indecency, which are mostly crimes of sexual assault, being perpetrated by men against women, making it clearly a gender issue and an exploitation of power." Supported by: Cathy Peattie, Marlyn Glen
S3M-5536.1 Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home (lodged on 21 January 2010) Margaret Curran*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Mary Mulligan*, Bill Butler*
S3M-5536.1 Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home (lodged on 21 January 2010) Sandra White*
S3M-5536.1 Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home (lodged on 21 January 2010) Gil Paterson*
S3M-5536.1 Breaking the Circle of Violence: Scared to Go Home (lodged on 21 January 2010) Johann Lamont* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
